Content:: Jeyaratnam Thiviyanathan (born 20 April 1952) is a Sri Lankan Tamil politician and former Member of Parliament. Thiviyanathan was born on 20 April 1952.[1] He was educated at Jaffna Central College.[2] He is a Roman Catholic.[1] Thiviyanathan contested the 1989 parliamentary election as one of the Eelam People's Revolutionary Liberation Front's candidates in Ampara District and was elected to Parliament.[3]  This article about a politician from Eastern Province, Sri Lanka is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
